channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump blasts Putin, questioning if Russian leader wants peace or is just 'tapping me along'
item.description: President Donald Trump has expressed doubts that Russian President Vladimir Putin wants to end its war with Ukraine which has raged for more than thre...

item.title: Trump believes Putin may be stringing him along after latest bombing
item.description: President Trump acknowledged that Russian President Vladimir Putin may be "tapping me along" following another round of missile strikes in Ukraine.

item.title: 'No excuse': Bipartisan fury erupts over New Jersey's REAL ID backlog
item.description: New Jersey is at the bottom of a CBS survey for REAL ID-compliant states, and bipartisan outrage has ensued.

item.title: What to Do with the Rot on Our Country’s Campuses?
item.description: The slap of firm government is the only way to right admissions, hiring, antisemitism, and staff bloat.

item.title: Dem Sen. Jon Ossoff on the Impeach Trump bandwagon
item.description: Georgia Sen. Jon Ossoff joined the small crowd of Democratic lawmakers calling for President Trump to be impeached.

item.title: Economies Are Now Battlefields
item.description: Edward Fishman provides timely lessons on the potential, but also the limits, of U.S. power to impose its will through economic warfare.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr. tells East Europe to pick the U.S. over China for deals
item.description: Trump Jr. is holding a roadshow called “Trump Business Vision 2025.”

item.title: Fox News Digital's Presidential 100 Days Quiz

item.title: Trump’s Job Is to Enforce Congress’s Immigration Laws, Not Make Up His Own
item.description: The president has no power of his own to deport anyone; he has the power that Congress has given him.

item.title: China Is the Hidden Issue in Canada’s Upcoming Election

item.title: USDA threatens to halt Mexican beef imports over flesh-eating fly crisis

item.title: ICE deports the mother of an infant and a 2-year-old who is a U.S. citizen

item.title: Kevin Hart says there’s one thing still worth splurging on in this uncertain economy, regardless of income level
item.description: With consumer confidence down and market volatility up, Americans are tightening their belts right now.

item.title: What Makes a City Wealthy?
item.description: Two juxtaposed buildings in South Carolina’s largest city raise questions of what wealth really means.

item.title: Wife of U.S. Coast Guard member arrested over expired visa after security check for military housing

item.title: Silicon Valley’s intense energy demands for AI are making coal-fired power plants a hot-ticket item again
item.description: Tech companies are eyeing coal-fired power plants headed for retirement because of their connections to the grid that a new power plant could use.

item.title: Tesla hikes Canadian prices and pushes its pre-tariff inventory
item.description: Tesla's Canadian website says: “Explore pre-tariff priced inventory while supplies last.”

item.title: Google says Chrome will suffer if it’s forced to sell the world’s most popular web browser
item.description: “I don’t think it could be recreated,” Chrome's general manager said about its success under Google.

item.title: Gun Control Doesn’t Stop Shootings Outside The United States, So It Won’t Here Either
item.description: Targeted attacks on schools are not uniquely American. They are global phenomena driven by evil, not geography or firearms laws.

item.title: NYT Wants You To Feel Very Sorry For This Drug-Dealing Kidnapper Trump Deported
item.description: He made bad choices and is owed no sympathy. He owes the U.S. thanks for the opportunities he was given even after conviction.

item.title: SCOTUS’s Refusal To End Leftists’ Judicial Coup Is Damaging Its Credibility More Than The Media Ever Could
item.description: By refusing to rein in the lower courts' lawlessness, SCOTUS has greenlit a judicial coup that is stymying the will of 77 million Americans.

item.title: Small Caps vs. Large Caps: The Cycle That’s About to Turn
